Workflows.name: DFT Geometry Optimization + Frequency Analysis
Workflows.goal: Obtain optimized structure and verify it is a minimum.
Workflows.long_explanation: DFT Geometry Optimization + Frequency Analysis is a widely used computational quantum chemistry workflow. This expanded entry describes theoretical motivation, step-by-step breakdown, recommended parameters, pitfalls, convergence strategies, and validation methods.

steps.description: Build molecule with ASE or editor.

faq.q: When should I use DFT Geometry Optimization + Frequency Analysis?
faq.a: Whenever the stated goal matches your computational task.

faq.q: How do I validate this workflow?
faq.a: Check convergence, frequencies, and compare to benchmarks.

Workflows.name: CP2K AIMD Workflow
Workflows.goal: Run ab initio molecular dynamics in condensed phase.
Workflows.long_explanation: CP2K AIMD Workflow is a widely used computational quantum chemistry workflow. This expanded entry describes theoretical motivation, step-by-step breakdown, recommended parameters, pitfalls, convergence strategies, and validation methods.

steps.description: Perform NVT or NPT AIMD run.

faq.q: When should I use CP2K AIMD Workflow?

faq.q: How do I validate this workflow?
faq.a: Check convergence, frequencies, and compare to benchmarks.

steps: Calculate mean absolute error (MAE) and root-mean-square deviation (RMSD)
Optimize ground state geometry with DFT
Run TD-DFT calculation for excited states
Extract excitation energies and oscillator strengths
Define target properties (Tc, conductivity, ZT, ε, μ)
Calculate electronic band structure and DOS
Compute phonon dispersion and electron-phonon coupling
Define frequency band and target RCS reduction
Design unit cell geometry (split-ring, fishnet, etc.)
Run FDTD simulation of unit cell
Extract effective ε and μ using S-parameters
Optimize geometry for impedance matching to free space
Define application requirements (NEP, SNR, bandwidth, SWAP-C)
Extract complex permittivity ε(ω) and conductivity σ(ω)
Calculate transport properties with BoltzTraP at multiple temperatures
Calculate Seebeck coefficient, conductivity, power factor
Estimate lattice thermal conductivity (empirical or DFT)
Select metal combinations (M, M' in A_x M[M'(CN)6]_y)
Predict cycle life from strain analysis
Rank compositions by energy density and cycle life

BenchmarkSets.name: S22 Set
BenchmarkSets.description: Noncovalent interaction benchmark.
BenchmarkSets.long_explanation: S22 Set is a widely used quantum chemistry benchmark set. This expanded entry includes details on its purpose, dataset structure, reference methods (often CCSD(T)/CBS), statistical metrics (MAE/RMSE/MAD), applicability to different classes of methods, and best practices for benchmarking new functionals or computational workflows.

faq.q: What is the purpose of this benchmark?
faq.a: It tests theoretical method reliability.
Using statistical metrics against reference energies.

Resources.title: Quantum Chemistry
Resources.summary: A classical introduction covering wave mechanics and electronic structure.
Resources.long_explanation: Quantum Chemistry is a significant resource in quantum chemistry. This expanded entry includes context, historical importance, major topics covered, strengths, limitations, the intended audience, and how it supports learning or research in quantum chemistry.

faq.a: It provides essential foundations for QC.

UseCases.name: Defense ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance)
UseCases.description: Q-SMEC sensors for ISR applications with order-of-magnitude improvements in signal-to-noise ratio and sensitivity

UseCases.name: Electronic Warfare (EW)
UseCases.description: Advanced electromagnetic sensors for EW applications including jamming detection and countermeasures

UseCases.name: THz Sensor/Emitter Systems
UseCases.description: Terahertz sensors with exceptional NEP, SNR, and figure of merit for 6G communications and non-destructive inspection

UseCases.name: RCS ELO Stealth Material
UseCases.description: Multispectral stealth material via complex permittivity/permeability tuning for radar cross-section reduction

UseCases.name: Prussian Blue/White Alternative Energy Storage
UseCases.description: Advanced battery storage targeting improvements in diffusion channels, conductivity, redox voltage, and strain minimization

UseCases.name: Smart Grid & Microgrid Sensors
UseCases.description: Ultra-sensitive sensors for smart grid monitoring, fault detection, and predictive maintenance

UseCases.name: IMU Navigation Systems
UseCases.description: Inertial measurement units with quantum-enhanced accelerometers and gyroscopes for precision navigation

UseCases.name: Automotive Lidar/Radar Sensors
UseCases.description: Advanced Lidar and radar sensors for ADAS/AV applications with enhanced resolution and range

UseCases.name: High-Flow Graphene Desalination Membranes
UseCases.description: Quantum-optimized graphene membranes for high-throughput water desalination with improved energy efficiency

UseCases.name: Real-Time Water Quality Sensors
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for real-time monitoring of water quality parameters with ultra-high sensitivity

UseCases.name: Pico ELISA-qPCR Biosensors
UseCases.description: Ultra-sensitive biosensors combining ELISA and qPCR capabilities at picogram detection levels

UseCases.name: Continuous Glucose Monitoring
UseCases.description: Non-invasive or minimally invasive continuous glucose monitoring using quantum sensors

UseCases.name: EM Hybrid Sensors for Mineral Exploration
UseCases.description: Advanced electromagnetic sensors for mineral exploration with enhanced depth penetration and resolution

UseCases.name: SCADA/Automation Sensors
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors integrated with AI-SCADA systems for industrial automation and process control

UseCases.name: Pipeline Leak Detection
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for early detection of pipeline leaks and structural integrity monitoring

UseCases.name: Emissions Monitoring (Methane, VOCs)
UseCases.description: Ultra-sensitive quantum sensors for monitoring methane and VOC emissions

UseCases.name: Structural Health Monitoring
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for continuous monitoring of structural integrity in buildings and civil infrastructure

UseCases.name: Seismic/Fire/Vital Sign Sensors
UseCases.description: Multi-purpose quantum sensors for emergency management applications

UseCases.name: Precision Agriculture Crop Monitoring
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for precision agriculture monitoring crop health, soil conditions, and environmental parameters

UseCases.name: Food Safety Sensors
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for real-time food safety monitoring detecting pathogens and contaminants

UseCases.name: 5G/6G Base Station Sensors
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for 5G/6G base station monitoring and optimization

UseCases.name: Data Center Predictive Maintenance
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for predictive maintenance and environmental monitoring in data centers

UseCases.name: Hypersonic Missile Guidance
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for hypersonic vehicle guidance, navigation, and control

UseCases.name: Directed Energy Weapons Sensors
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for directed energy weapon beam control and target tracking

UseCases.name: Space Situational Awareness
UseCases.description: Quantum sensors for tracking and characterizing space objects

UseCases.name: Terahertz Sensor/Emitter (Expanded)
UseCases.description: Advanced THz sensor/emitter systems for national security, high-speed wireless communications, spectroscopy analysis, and medical health imaging applications

UseCases.name: Solid-State High-Energy Laser
UseCases.description: Q-SMEC-enabled solid-state high-energy lasers for directed energy weapons, fusion energy ignition, precision medical surgery, and ISR/EA applications

UseCases.name: Extra-Low Frequency Subsurface Sensor
UseCases.description: ELF/VLF quantum sensors for covert naval communications, mineral exploration (Cu/Ag/Mo deposits), and underground structure detection

UseCases.name: Data Center Power Optimization
UseCases.description: Q-SMEC sensors enabling 30-50% reduction in server, HVAC, and PDU power consumption through real-time thermal and energy monitoring

UseCases.name: Cyber-PUF Security Sensor
UseCases.description: Quantum-enhanced Physical Unclonable Function (PUF) sensors for firmware binding, device authentication, and intrusion detection

UseCases.name: Quantum Navigation and Timekeeping
UseCases.description: DARPA/DOE-aligned quantum navigation and atomic clock systems for GPS-denied environments with relativistic precision sensing

UseCases.name: Electromagnetic Countermeasure (ECM)
UseCases.description: Advanced ECM system with quantum spectrum sensing, signal cancellation, and directional jamming for ISR/EA missions

UseCases.name: Bio-signal & Imaging Sensor
UseCases.description: Ultra-sensitive quantum sensors for brain-machine interfaces and sub-picotesla biomagnetic signal capture (MEG, MCG)

UseCases.name: Environmental or Climate Monitoring
UseCases.description: Atomic-scale quantum sensors for nanoparticle detection and environmental monitoring in air, water, and soil with unprecedented sensitivity

UseCases.name: Quantum-Optimized Drug Design Sensor
UseCases.description: Advanced quantum sensors for molecular interaction mapping and detection to screen therapeutic targets and accelerate drug discovery

Equations.description: Roothaan-Hall equations (matrix form of HF equations)
Noise Equivalent Power - minimum detectable signal power
Figure of Merit for THz sensors
Detector responsivity - output current per incident power

Radar cross section for stealth applications
